overview_of_class: By using music, this course introduces students to the delights and understanding of great Russian Poetry. Professor Irwin Weil explains the historical and cultural background of some of the outstanding works by Russian Poets. Dr. Natalia Lyashenko, formerly the choral conductor of a major Russian Opera Company, conducts rehearsals of operatic choruses from operas based on works by these poets. The students, coached in the language by Professor Weil, get to sing in a concert exhibiting some of the extraordinary beauty of music created by Tchaikovsky and other fine Russian Composers. No previous knowledge of the language or the music is required.
